blog.name: marvelzombiespromos
blog.title: Marvel Zombies Promos
blog.description:
This is the promo page for Marvel Zombies RP. For more information, please visit our main page.

The characters advertised are not an exclusive list, rather they are a short list of suggestions. Our intention is to maintain a rotor of characters from a variety of backgrounds. Please feel free to apply outside of the characters posted here.

summary: Marvel Zombies RP Wanted Connection: Carol Danvers Requested by: Jessica Drew Telephone networks have failed, the internet is...
caption:
Marvel Zombies RP Wanted Connection: Carol Danvers
Requested by: Jessica Drew

Telephone networks have failed, the internet is gone. Modern communication seems to have come to an end. What remains is radiowaves. People with the right equipment have begun to communicate with anyone in range using CB radios, walkie talkies, whatever they can get their hands on. Some are broadcasting, some are just listening.

Carol slowly tuned through the channels on the old radio, she had crash landed on her reentry into the Earth’s atmosphere, and when she made it to Manhattan, the Tower was a wreckage. She heard the crackling sound of numbers coming through as she found an active channel –

This is Jessica Drew broadcasting for Carol Danvers. On the off chance you’re not in space and you’re out there, there’s somewhere safe. Haven. I’m here with Gerry. Clint is here. And Peter. Nat, Bobbi, Tony… I’ve saved you a room so you better get your ass here before someone steals it. Hope to see you soon! Love you, Kirk. Co-ordinates to follow…

Marvel Zombies RP is a Marvel Comics AU roleplay established 1 April 2017. We look forward to surviving with you.

Home || Plot || Rules || Taken/Open Characters || FAQ || Most Wanted

summary:
what if annihilation avengers 4 starts off right where ant-man and the wasp post-credit scenes end?
it starts and all we see is...
body:
so you know how infinity war starts off right where ragnarok post-credit scenes end right

what if annihilation avengers 4 starts off right where ant-man and the wasp post-credit scenes end?

it starts and all we see is the hanging radio and scott’s voice screaming where hank, hope and janet went

and then we see him in the subatomic world getting sucked into a time vortex, passing out, then waking up in the battle of new york and then it cuts out and goes back to whoever

*insert the whole supposed time stone theory and them going back in time to get the tesseract scene here*

things are going horribly wrong and all of a sudden giAntMan is just There in all his glory and he’s like “‘Whats up Cap? Stark? You guys friends again?”

and THATS how we end up with this scene

blog.title: with great power comes no future
blog.description: i used to have nothing. and then i got this job...this family. and it made me better. and now they're gone, and i'm still trying to be better. - eliza, she/they, icon by bigstarkenergy.

summary: CAPTAIN MARVEL: EARTH’S MIGHTIEST HERO VOL. 5 TPB Written by MICHELE FAZEKAS, TARA BUTTERS, RUTH FLETCHER GAGE & CHRISTOS GAGE...
caption:
CAPTAIN MARVEL: EARTH’S MIGHTIEST HERO VOL. 5 TPB

Written by MICHELE FAZEKAS, TARA BUTTERS, RUTH FLETCHER GAGE & CHRISTOS GAGE
Penciled by KRIS ANKA, FELIPE SMITH, MARCO FAILLA & THONY SILAS
Cover by JAMIE MCKELVIE
It’s a bold new frontier for Carol Danvers, soaring to ever greater heights as the leader of the all-new Alpha Flight space program! Yup, Alpha Flight — including classic favorites Puck, Sasquatch and Aurora! As Earth’s first line of defense, Carol and her team aim to protect the planet from extraterrestrial threats. But can Carol be both a soldier and a diplomat? Don’t ask Tony Stark! These two old friends are about to face off as bitter enemies in an event that will change Captain Marvel’s life forever! As Inhuman visions of the future kick off a second superhuman civil war, Captain Marvel is at the forefront of the conflict — with Iron Man now her implacable enemy. But when tragedy hits close to home, how far will Carol go to protect what she believes in? Collecting CAPTAIN MARVEL (2016) #1-10.
232 PGS./Rated T+ …$24.99
ISBN: 978-1-302-91541-4

summary: MARVEL’S CAPTAIN MARVEL: THE ART OF THE MOVIE HC Written by ELENI ROUSSOS Penciled by VARIOUS Go behind the scenes of the highly...
caption:
MARVEL’S CAPTAIN MARVEL: THE ART OF THE MOVIE HC

Written by ELENI ROUSSOS
Penciled by VARIOUS
Go behind the scenes of the highly anticipated Captain Marvel film with this latest in Marvel’s ART OF series! Ace Air Force pilot Carol Danvers becomes one of the universe’s most powerful heroes when Earth is caught in the middle of a galactic war between two alien races! This collectible volume is full of exclusive concept art and interviews with the creators behind Marvel Studios’ first solo super heroine!
240 PGS./All Ages …$50.00
ISBN: 978-1-302-91527-8
Trim size: landscape

summary: MARVEL’S CAPTAIN MARVEL PRELUDE TPB Written by WILL CORONA PILGRIM, ROY THOMAS, GERRY CONWAY, BRIAN REED, KELLY SUE DECONNICK &...
caption:
MARVEL’S CAPTAIN MARVEL PRELUDE TPB

Written by WILL CORONA PILGRIM, ROY THOMAS, GERRY CONWAY, BRIAN REED, KELLY SUE DECONNICK & MARGARET STOHL
Penciled by ANDREA DI VITO, GENE COLAN, JOHN BUSCEMA, ROBERTO DE LA TORRE, DEXTER SOY, BRENT SCHOONOVER & CARLOS PACHECO
Prepare for Captain Marvel’s cinematic debut with titanic tales setting the stage for the Marvel Universe’s mightiest hero! When an encounter with Kree soldier Mar-Vell grants Carol Danvers amazing powers, she begins a costumed career…as Ms. Marvel! Determined to prove herself the best of the best in a world full of fearsome foes, Carol takes on the mantle of Captain Marvel — and the responsibility of protecting the entire planet! But what happens when she comes face-to-face with Mar-Vell…who died years before? Plus: Look back at Carol’s early days, and learn what shaped the woman behind the mask! Collecting MARVEL’S CAPTAIN MARVEL PRELUDE, MARVEL SUPER-HEROES (1967) #13, MS. MARVEL (1977) #1, MS. MARVEL (2006) #1, CAPTAIN MARVEL (2012) #1, GENERATIONS: CAPTAIN MARVEL & CAPTAIN MAR-VELL and LIFE OF CAPTAIN MARVEL (2018) #1.
152 PGS./Rated T …$17.99
ISBN: 978-1-302-91494-3

blog.name: comicsqualityreviews
blog.title: Comic-book Quality Reviews
blog.description: I have been reading comic books all my life but there is still too many comics to read. Join me in this fun journey of figuring out my personal favorites.

title: The Power of Shazam!
body:
The Power of Shazam. March, 1994.
By Jerry Ordway.

This is the origin story of Captain Marvel (nowadays only known as Shazam). At least the final attempt during the post-crisis era (and before Jeff Parker’s origin story). This one made a big impact on the character as it spun off its own ongoing series that lasted four years. This in Captain Marvel’s history post Fawcett Comics, is a lot.

We learn about Billy’s parent, who were betrayed by Adam on an archaeological site. Adam killed them and took Mary with him (Billy’s sister). Billy, who had to stay at home during his family trip, ended up being kicked out by his uncle, who was now in charge of him.

Now living in the streets, Billy is contacted by a strange man, who takes him into the subway to meet the wizard. The wizard gives Shazam his power to become Captain Marvel (it is never explained why he is a captain). Billy is not convinced about all this, but the transference is done and he goes back to being Billy, sleeping in the streets.

While awake, he converts to Captain Marvel in order to stop a bombing at Whiz radio, an attempt of Sivana and Adam to silence some witnesses from the archaeological site. Captain Marvel manages to stop the bombing and also destroy Sivana’s priced projects.

The Wizard tells Billy he will recognize the killer of his parents the next time he sees him. At the same time, Adam realizes this is all linked to that site, and becomes Black Adam with the help of the trinket from Ramses II tomb.

Both champions fight each other as all truth is revealed. Captain marvel spares Adam’s life after destroying the trinket, but the wizard takes Adam’s voice and memories.

On the last contact with the wizard, Billy meets his father once again, and is told that he will discover what happened to Mary if he continues being the Captain Marvel.

He then, passes as his uncle at school to keep his secret life (and avoid being handed over to the State custody).

Of all the Shazam origins I have read, this is probably still my favorite. Geoff Johns take is also good, but doesn’t seem like the same character.

This origin has more things taken directly from the Golden Age version, and I think that is why it lasted (the Justice Society was also making a come back around this time). This led to Black Adam becoming part of so many JSA stories.

Beyond the obvious homages in this story, I find the novel very easy to read and a good starting point for readers. However, it doesn’t have any ethical or philosophical themes to keep thinking about once you finish reading it. It wasn’t necessary, but it would have been a plus.

The art, of course, is the prized gem of this novel. It took Ordway two years to finish it and is to date, one of the finest graphic novels I have ever read in terms of mesmerizing art.

I give the novel a score of 9.75.

reblog.comment:
The Power of Shazam. March, 1994.
By Jerry Ordway.

This is the origin story of Captain Marvel (nowadays only known as Shazam). At least the final attempt during the post-crisis era (and before Jeff Parker’s origin story). This one made a big impact on the character as it spun off its own ongoing series that lasted four years. This in Captain Marvel’s history post Fawcett Comics, is a lot.

We learn about Billy’s parent, who were betrayed by Adam on an archaeological site. Adam killed them and took Mary with him (Billy’s sister). Billy, who had to stay at home during his family trip, ended up being kicked out by his uncle, who was now in charge of him.

Now living in the streets, Billy is contacted by a strange man, who takes him into the subway to meet the wizard. The wizard gives Shazam his power to become Captain Marvel (it is never explained why he is a captain). Billy is not convinced about all this, but the transference is done and he goes back to being Billy, sleeping in the streets.

While awake, he converts to Captain Marvel in order to stop a bombing at Whiz radio, an attempt of Sivana and Adam to silence some witnesses from the archaeological site. Captain Marvel manages to stop the bombing and also destroy Sivana’s priced projects.

The Wizard tells Billy he will recognize the killer of his parents the next time he sees him. At the same time, Adam realizes this is all linked to that site, and becomes Black Adam with the help of the trinket from Ramses II tomb.

Both champions fight each other as all truth is revealed. Captain marvel spares Adam’s life after destroying the trinket, but the wizard takes Adam’s voice and memories.

On the last contact with the wizard, Billy meets his father once again, and is told that he will discover what happened to Mary if he continues being the Captain Marvel.

He then, passes as his uncle at school to keep his secret life (and avoid being handed over to the State custody).

Of all the Shazam origins I have read, this is probably still my favorite. Geoff Johns take is also good, but doesn’t seem like the same character.

This origin has more things taken directly from the Golden Age version, and I think that is why it lasted (the Justice Society was also making a come back around this time). This led to Black Adam becoming part of so many JSA stories.

Beyond the obvious homages in this story, I find the novel very easy to read and a good starting point for readers. However, it doesn’t have any ethical or philosophical themes to keep thinking about once you finish reading it. It wasn’t necessary, but it would have been a plus.

The art, of course, is the prized gem of this novel. It took Ordway two years to finish it and is to date, one of the finest graphic novels I have ever read in terms of mesmerizing art.

summary: Update on the Captain Marvel pre-party photoshoot: went pretty well and as the not-really-ours-but-she-adopted-us cat showed up,...
body: Update on the Captain Marvel pre-party photoshoot: went pretty well and as the not-really-ours-but-she-adopted-us cat showed up, Carol had Chewie with her in most of the photos :)
